## Introduction

## Sypnosis

The analysis is trying to answer the following questions:

1. Across the United States, which types of events are most harmful with respect to population health?
2. Across the United States, which types of events have the greatest economic consequences?

### 1. Download Data

```{R}
zip_url <- "https://d396qusza40orc.cloudfront.net/repdata%2Fdata%2FStormData.csv.bz2"
zip_filename <- "StormData.csv.bz2"

if(!file.exists(zip_filename)){
    download.file(zip_url, zip_filename, method="curl")
}
```

### 2. Load Data into dataset

```{R}
df0 <- read.csv(zip_filename, header=TRUE, sep=",")

# Print out dimension of raw data
dim(df0)

# List out column names
names(df0)

# Check first 5 rows of raw data
head(df0)
```

### 3. Data Cleansing

```{R, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)

df1 <- select(df0, EVTYPE, FATALITIES, INJURIES, PROPDMG, PROPDMGEXP, CROPDMG, CROPDMGEXP)
```

### 4. Analysing Data

#### 4.1 Events are most harmful with respect to population health.

```{R}
ds1 <- df1 %>%
    group_by(EVTYPE) %>%
    summarise(health_affected = sum(FATALITIES + INJURIES)) %>%
    arrange(desc(health_affected))

top10 <- ds1[1:10,]
with(top10, barplot(height = health_affected, names.arg = EVTYPE, las = 3))
```

#### 4.2 Events have the greatest economic consequences

```{R}
# PROPDMG
df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="H",] <- df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="H",] %>%
    mutate(PROPDMG = PROPDMG * 10^2)

df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="K",] <- df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="K",] %>%
    mutate(PROPDMG = PROPDMG * 10^3)

df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="M",] <- df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="M",] %>%
    mutate(PROPDMG = PROPDMG * 10^6)

df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="B",] <- df1[df1$PROPDMGEXP=="B",] %>%
    mutate(PROPDMG = PROPDMG * 10^9)

#CROPDMG
df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="H",] <- df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="H",] %>%
    mutate(CROPDMG = CROPDMG * 10^2)

df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="K",] <- df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="K",] %>%
    mutate(CROPDMG = CROPDMG * 10^3)

df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="M",] <- df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="M",] %>%
    mutate(CROPDMG = CROPDMG * 10^6)

df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="B",] <- df1[df1$CROPDMGEXP=="B",] %>%
    mutate(CROPDMG = CROPDMG * 10^9)

ds2 <- df1 %>%
    group_by(EVTYPE) %>%
    summarise(total_amt_dmg = sum(PROPDMG + CROPDMG)) %>%
    arrange(desc(total_amt_dmg))

top10 <- ds2[1:10,]
with(top10, barplot(height = total_amt_dmg, names.arg = EVTYPE, las = 3))
```
